situation: A few players are playing a boardgame. The current state of the game is as follows. The butterfly invented a time machine. The mannikin brings an oil tank for the pigeon. And the rules of the game are as follows. Rule1: If something acquires a photo of the crow, then it enjoys the company of the mermaid, too. Rule2: From observing that an animal invests in the company owned by the mule, one can conclude the following: that animal does not bring an oil tank for the mouse. Rule3: For the mouse, if the belief is that the butterfly brings an oil tank for the mouse and the dachshund does not build a power plant close to the green fields of the mouse, then you can add "the mouse does not enjoy the company of the mermaid" to your conclusions. Rule4: There exists an animal which brings an oil tank for the pigeon? Then the mouse definitely acquires a photograph of the crow. Rule5: Regarding the butterfly, if it created a time machine, then we can conclude that it brings an oil tank for the mouse. Rule2 is preferred over Rule5. Rule3 is preferred over Rule1.
question: Based on the game state and the rules and preferences, does the mouse enjoy the company of the mermaid?
label: proved
